rule.description: Cisco-FTD Rules
Cisco-FTD: Alert Event.
Cisco-FTD: Critical Event Detected.
Cisco-FTD: Error Event.
Cisco-FTD: Warning Event.
Cisco-FTD: Notification/Informational Event.
Cisco-FTD: Debug Event.
Cisco-FTD: Failed Authentication Attempts Detected
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when a login attempt to the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device failed. The message occurs after multiple failed attempts (up to three) to log in via SSH, Telnet, or other management interfaces. This could indicate either an unauthorized access attempt or incorrect credentials provided by a legitimate user. Repeated failures might suggest a potential brute force attack.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Administrative Authentication Failure detected
rule.info: Description: Authentication failed for administrative user. This could indicate an attempt to gain unauthorized administrative access.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Authentication failure detected for IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because an authentication attempt for the user account "IFFCOADMIN" failed. The failure could be due to incorrect credentials being provided, a potential unauthorized access attempt, or an issue with the authentication system.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User Privilege Level Changed
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when the privilege level of a user on the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device was changed. This event indicates a modification in the user's access rights, either increasing or decreasing the permissions. Changes in privilege levels can be part of normal administrative operations, but may also signal unauthorized privilege escalation attempts.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User Priviledge Change by IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects and logs any changes in user privileges on a Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) device, specifically highlighting actions initiated by the user "IFFCOADMIN." This helps in monitoring and auditing administrative activities.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Successful Login Event Detected
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when a user successfully authenticated and initiated a management session on the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device. The event captures details of the source address, source port, destination interface, destination IP, service, and username associated with the login, indicating a valid access attempt.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Successful login for IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the user "IFFCOADMIN" successfully logged into the system. The successful authentication indicates that the provided credentials were correct and the user was granted access to the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: ARP Collision Detected Due to Conflicting MAC Addresses
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device received an ARP packet with a MAC address that conflicted with an existing ARP cache entry for the same IP address. This may indicate a network misconfiguration or a potential ARP spoofing attack.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Attempt to connect from a blocked (shunned) IP.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device detected a packet from a host IP address that is listed in the shun database. The shunned host is prohibited from passing traffic on the specified interface, indicating that it may be involved in malicious activity or has been explicitly blocked for security reasons.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: AAA (VPN) authentication failed.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the AAA (Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting) server failed to authenticate a user attempting to connect. The failure could be due to various reasons, including incorrect credentials, an unreachable AAA server, or other AAA-related issues. The username may be hidden depending on the configuration but will appear when valid or if logging is set to show usernames.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: AAA (VPN) authentication successful.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because a user successfully completed an AAA (Authentication, Authorization, and Accounting) operation on an IPsec or WebVPN connection. The operation could involve authentication, authorization, or accounting. The AAA server responded positively, allowing the connection for the user.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: AAA (VPN) user locked out.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because a locally configured user was locked out after exceeding the maximum number of consecutive failed authentication attempts. All further authentication attempts for this user will be denied until an administrator manually unlocks the account using the appropriate command.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Disallowing New Connections Due to Unreachable Syslog Server
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because new connections were disallowed after the syslog server, required for logging TCP system messages, became unreachable. This indicates a failure in communication with the syslog server, which is critical for logging and monitoring purposes.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Firewall failover pair communication problem.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered due to a failure in failover communications or testing between the primary and secondary units of the failover pair on the specified interface. The rule detects issues when the failover link is down, when ARP packets cannot pass between the units, or when interface testing passes or fails.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Firewall configuration deleted.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the contents of the firewall's flash memory were erased using the "write erase" command. The event can occur through a console login or a Telnet connection, indicated by the associated IP address. This action resets the device to factory settings, potentially impacting device configuration and security policies.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Firewall configuration changed.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered due to configuration activities on the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device. These activities include exiting the configuration mode, reading or writing configurations from/to a device (such as memory, network, or failover standby), or reloading configurations. The IP address indicates whether the login was made via the console port or Telnet connection.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User created on the Firewall.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when a new user was created in the local user database. The log includes the username, assigned privilege level, and the encrypted password. This is crucial for tracking changes to user accounts, ensuring proper access control and monitoring of administrative activities.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User Account Creation - IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because a new user account named "IFFCOADMIN" was successfully created on the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: IP spoofing attack detected.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when a packet with a spoofed or invalid source IP address, such as loopback, broadcast, or an internal IP address, was detected and denied by the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device. These spoofed packets often indicate malicious attempts to bypass network security by impersonating a legitimate IP address.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: ACL denies non-IP packet, triggering message display despite log option absence.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because an ACL on the Cisco FTD firewall denied a non-IP packet. Even though the logging option was not enabled, the denial still prompted the system to generate a message due to the packet's non-compliance with the ACL's filtering criteria.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Authentication Failure in RIP Reply Indicates Potential Security Compromise
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because an authentication failure was detected in a RIP (Routing Information Protocol) reply message. Such failures can indicate a potential security compromise, as they may suggest unauthorized attempts to manipulate routing information or exploit the network.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User unlocked by administrator.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the user account was locked after exceeding the allowed number of successive failed authentication attempts. The lockout is a security measure to prevent unauthorized access due to potential brute force or password-guessing attacks.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Successful Local Authentication for IPsec/WebVPN User
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because a user associated with an IPsec or WebVPN connection successfully authenticated to the local user database. The authentication indicates that the user's credentials were verified and matched the information stored locally, granting them access to the secure VPN connection.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: AAA User Authentication Rejected for IPsec/WebVPN Connection.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because a user's authentication request to the local database for an IPsec or WebVPN connection was rejected. The rejection occurred due to an invalid or unknown username, incorrect credentials, or another authentication issue. The username may be hidden depending on the configuration settings.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: AAA User Authentication Rejected Due to Server or Policy Violation.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because an AAA transaction for a user associated with an IPsec or WebVPN connection failed due to an error or was rejected because of a policy violation. The failure indicates that the user's credentials were not accepted, potentially due to incorrect credentials, server issues, or a breach of security policies.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: RADIUS Server Marked as Failed Due to No Response
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Cisco FTD device did not receive a response from the RADIUS server within the configured timeout period during an AAA request. As a result, the server was marked as failed and removed from service, indicating a potential network issue or server unavailability.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: IPsec Proxy Mismatches Have Occurred.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because an IPsec Security Association (SA) could not be created due to a proxy mismatch, where the hosts involved in the negotiation were blocked by an ACL deny policy.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Privileged Mode Access Blocked After Maximum Failed Password Attempts.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because a user entered the console enable password incorrectly three times, reaching the maximum allowed attempts. This could indicate a potential unauthorized access attempt or a user error trying to enter privileged mode.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Policy Modification on the Firewall.
rule.info: Description: The rule refers to changes made to the security rules or access policies on a Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) firewall, which could involve altering, adding, or removing rules that govern network traffic and security posture. These modifications can impact the firewall's ability to allow or deny specific types of traffic based on the updated policies.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Policy Modification by IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects and logs any changes made to the firewall policy by the user "IFFCOADMIN," ensuring that any unauthorized or suspicious modifications are flagged for review.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User deleted on the Firewall.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects and alerts when a user account is deleted on a Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) firewall, indicating potential unauthorized access or administrative changes to the firewall configuration.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User Account Deletion - IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: The rule that triggers an alert when a user account with the name "IFFCOADMIN" is deleted on a Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) device, indicating a potential unauthorized or significant administrative action.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: VPN Peer Certificate Subject Name Mismatch Detected.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the peer certificate's subject name did not match the expected value during a VPN connection attempt. This mismatch could indicate a potential man-in-the-middle attack, where an unauthorized device is attempting to spoof the peer's IP address and intercept the VPN connection from the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: MAC Address Spoofing Attempt Detected on Interface
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device received a packet from a MAC address on an interface where it is not expected, as it is statically bound to another interface. This discrepancy suggests a possible MAC-spoofing attack, where an attacker may be attempting to impersonate a legitimate device, or it could indicate a network misconfiguration.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: ARP Inspection Failed Due to IP-MAC Binding Mismatch.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the ARP inspection module detected a mismatch between the advertised IP-MAC address binding in an ARP request or response and the expected binding, which is either statically configured or dynamically learned. This failure suggests a potential ARP spoofing attack, where an attacker may be attempting to redirect network traffic, or it could indicate a misconfiguration in the network's IP-MAC binding.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Duplicate IPv6 Address or MAC Address Detected on Interface
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device detected another system on the network using the same IPv6 address as the device on a specific interface. This situation could indicate an IP address conflict, possibly due to a misconfiguration or a network scanning attempt by another device. The duplicate address may lead to network instability or security risks.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Dynamic DNS Update Failed for FQDN (Fully Qualified Domain Name).
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device failed to update the DNS records for a specified fully qualified domain name (FQDN) with the provided IP address. The failure may be due to the device being unable to contact the DNS server or because the DNS service is not running on the target system, potentially leading to outdated or incorrect DNS information.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Mismatched IPsec Protocol Data Received from Remote Endpoint.
rule.info: Description: An IPsec packet was received that is missing the expected ESP header. The peer is sending packets that do not match the negotiated security policy, which may indicate an attack. This message is rate limited to no more than one message every five seconds.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Non-IPsec Packet Received from IPsec Peer.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device received a packet from a remote endpoint that matched the crypto map ACL but was not IPsec-encapsulated. This could be due to a policy misconfiguration on the peer device, where traffic expected to be encrypted was sent without IPsec encapsulation. Alternatively, it might indicate a potential attack, where an adversary attempts to send unencrypted traffic that bypasses security policies.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: IPsec Packet Authentication Failure from Remote Endpoint.
rule.info: Description: An IPsec packet was received and failed authentication. The packet is dropped. The packet may have been corrupted in transit, or the peer may be sending invalid IPsec packets, which may indicate an attack if many of these packets were received from the same peer. This message rate is limited to no more than one message every five seconds.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: SSL Memory Allocation Request Denied Due to Size Limit.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because an SSL connection attempted to allocate a memory block larger than the allowed limit on the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device. The request was denied to prevent excessive resource consumption, which could indicate either a misconfigured SSL connection or a potential attack aimed at exhausting system resources.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: DMA Memory Block Release Failed Due to Internal Software Error
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device encountered an internal software error while attempting to release a Direct Memory Access (DMA) memory block at a specific address. This issue may indicate a software bug or memory management problem within the device's cryptographic processes.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: FTP Port Command Address Mismatch Detected and Connection Terminated
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device detected an FTP client issuing a port command with an IP address that differed from the one used in the original connection. This discrepancy could indicate an attempt to bypass security controls, such as a potential session hijacking attack. The device dropped the packet, terminated the connection, and logged the event to prevent unauthorized access or data manipulation.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Invalid Authentication Key Detected on Interface
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device detected that the authentication key configured on the specified interface is not valid. This issue prevents successful authentication for connections using this key, potentially leading to connectivity or security policy enforcement problems.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: AAA Fallback Method Initiated Due to Unreachable Authentication Server
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device attempted to authenticate or authorize a user through an external AAA server group, but the server was unreachable. As a result, the fallback method (such as using the local user database) was initiated to process the authentication or authorization request for the user.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: TCP Connection Probed by Dead Connection Detection (DCD)
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device probed an existing TCP connection using Dead Connection Detection (DCD) to verify whether the connection was still valid. This occurs as part of the device’s routine to identify and remove stale or inactive connections.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Successful User Authentication for Access to the Device
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because a user successfully authenticated to the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device from a specific IP address. The username was provided in the log, indicating a valid authentication event. This message confirms the user's access to the device.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User Authentication Failed for User
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when a user failed to authenticate while attempting to access the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device. The event logs the IP address of the client and the username of the user who failed authentication. This failed login could indicate an unauthorized access attempt or incorrect credentials.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: TCP/UDP Access Denied by ACL from Unauthorized Source
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device denied an attempt to connect to a service based on the Access Control List (ACL) rules. The connection attempt, such as an unauthorized SNMP request, was blocked by the ACL. Frequent occurrences of this message may indicate an ongoing attack or repeated unauthorized access attempts.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Duplicate Packet Detected for Existing Tunnel Negotiation
rule.info: Description: This rule is triggered when the Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense device detects a duplicate first packet from a peer during the negotiation of an already established tunnel. This typically occurs when the device receives a retransmission of a packet from the peer.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: XAUTH Required but Selected IKE Proposal Does Not Support XAUTH
rule.info: Description: This rule is triggered when the Cisco Secure Firewall Threat Defense device encounters a mismatch during the IKE negotiation, where the peer requests XAUTH, but the selected IKE proposal on the device does not support XAUTH. This issue may be due to incorrect priority settings in the IKE proposal list.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Potential Denial of IP Due to Land Attack
rule.info: Description: This event occurs when the Cisco Firepower Threat Defense (FTD) detects and blocks a Land Attack. The rule triggers when the device receives a spoofed packet with identical source and destination IP addresses and ports, a characteristic of this type of attack. A Land Attack aims to disrupt network operations by exploiting the device’s handling of traffic.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Potential IP Address Spoofing Attack Detected
rule.info: Description: Unicast RPF detected a packet with an invalid source address, indicating a potential IP spoofing attack. This occurs when a packet's source address is not represented by a route and is likely part of an attack attempt.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Connection Spoofing Attempt Detected
rule.info: Description: A packet matching an existing connection arrived on a different interface than the original connection, indicating possible connection hijacking attempt or asymmetric routing issue.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Access Control List Violation
rule.info: Description: Traffic was denied by an access control list (ACL). This indicates an attempt to access resources in violation of security policy.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User Failed Re-Authentication During Password Change
rule.info: Description: A user failed authentication while attempting to change their password. Multiple failures could indicate a password compromise attempt or brute force attack targeting the password change functionality.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Failed Console Login - Insufficient Admin Rights
rule.info: Description: A user attempted to access the management console without proper administrative privileges. This could indicate a potential privilege escalation attempt or unauthorized access to administrative functions. Failed console access attempts should be monitored as they may represent reconnaissance or attempted unauthorized system administration.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Potential Footprinting/Port Scanning Detected from Persistent Source.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered by the detection of "5" denials of non-IP packets from a single source within a "120 second" timeframe. The frequency and persistence of these messages suggest potential footprinting or port scanning activity, as the source may be probing the network to gather information or identify open ports.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: User account locked and subsequently unlocked by administrator within an hour.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered by the detection of a user account being locked due to excessive failed authentication attempts, followed by an administrative action to unlock the account within an hour.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: 5 times user authentication rejected for IPsec/WebVPN connection within 300 seconds.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when a user’s authentication to the local database for an IPsec or WebVPN connection was rejected 5 times within 300 seconds. The repeated failures suggest potential unauthorized access attempts or issues with user credentials.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: 5 times Login Failed Attempts Detected in 300 seconds.
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered because the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device detected 5 failed login attempts within a 300-second window. The repeated failed attempts from the source indicate a potential brute-force attack or unauthorized access attempt. The system denied the login after exceeding the allowed threshold for incorrect authentication attempts.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Multiple User Authentication Failures Detected for User
rule.info: Description: This rule was triggered when 5 failed authentication attempts were detected within a 60-second timeframe on the Secure Firewall Threat Defense device. The event logs the "IP address" of the client and the "username" of the user involved. Multiple failed login attempts in a short timeframe could indicate an attempted brute-force attack or repeated incorrect credentials.

rule.description: Cisco-FTD: Multiple Failed Console Login Attempts - Potential Privilege Escalation
rule.info: Description: Multiple (3 times) failed attempts to access the management console detected within a short timeframe of 60 seconds. This pattern suggests a potential targeted attempt to gain unauthorized administrative access to the system. High priority investigation recommended.
